alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 9:47PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. Heavy rain had ended earlier today and cooler temperatures will reduce snowmelt, but water continues to make its way through the river system. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Rivers continue to run high in the region, with several bridges and roads impacted by fast and high flowing water during the day today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 PM MDT, emergency manager reports from earlier in the day indicate that heavy rain yesterday into this morning has caused widespread flooding issues. - Clarks Fork Yellowstone River and its tributaries will continue to run high as upstream water moves through the river system.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Bridges and roads may be damaged.
